topic.title: How to Avoid Characters Being Rendered as #

body.p: When the processor renders text with a font that does not include certain characters, those characters are replaced with the # symbol.
To prevent this, make sure you use the proper font.

body.note: On Windows one simple way to determine the font needed to display the text is to copy the text fragment that has rendering problems from the DITA source document and paste it into the Microsoft Wordpad or Word. It will automatically select a font capable of rendering the text. Simply click on the text and see the name of the font from the "Font" ribbon toolbar. You can use it in the CSS. Make sure there are no licensing restrictions on that font.
